spanishExample: ¿Entiendes que trece son mejores que once?
englishTranslation: Do you understand that thirteen are better than eleven?
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entiendes: understand, you understand (Entender, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Cuatro por dos es igual a ocho.
englishTranslation: Four times two equals eight.

spanishExample: Diez más dos es igual a doce.
englishTranslation: Ten plus two equals twelve.

spanishExample: El doce y el catorce de este mes habrá un juego.
englishTranslation: On the twelfth and the fourteenth of this month there will be a game.
vocabIncluded: habrá: "there will be" indicating existence (Haber, future, impersonal)

spanishExample: Entendí que cinco por tres es igual a quince.
englishTranslation: I understood that five times three equals fifteen.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entendí: understood, I understood (Entender, preterite, 1st person)

spanishExample: Entendió la película después de seis veces.
englishTranslation: He understood the movie after six times.
vocabIncluded: entendió: understood, he/she/it understood (Entender, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Estaré ahí a las once en punto.
englishTranslation: I’ll be there at eleven o’clock.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
estaré: "will be", "I will be" (Estar, future, 1st person)

spanishExample: No entiende que catorce es mucho más que cinco.
englishTranslation: She doesn’t understand that fourteen is a lot more than five.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entiende: understands, he/she/it understands (Entender, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No entienden que once viene después de diez.
englishTranslation: They don’t understand that eleven comes after ten.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entienden: understand, they understand (Entender, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: No he muerto, entonces dame esos dos.
englishTranslation: I haven’t died, so give me those two.
vocabIncluded: he: "have", "I have" before a participle (Haber, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: No quiero morir con solo un coche.
englishTranslation: I don’t want to die with only one car.

spanishExample: No quiero que mueras, tienes catorce perros.
englishTranslation: I don’t want you to die, you have fourteen dogs.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
mueras: die, you die (Morir, subjunctive, 2nd person)

spanishExample: No te preocupes, no mueres en el juego con doce vidas, mueres con siete.
englishTranslation: Don’t worry, you don’t die in the game with twelve lives, you die with seven.
vocabIncluded: mueres: die, you die (Morir, present, 2nd person)
preocuparse: any use of to worry with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to to be worried)

spanishExample: Se está muriendo por tener todos los quince.
englishTranslation: He is dying to have all fifteen.
vocabIncluded: morirse: any use of morir with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to to die)

spanishExample: Si me muero, quiero que ella entienda que todo está bien.
englishTranslation: If I die, I want her to understand that everything is ok.
vocabIncluded: "bien": adverb meaning "well", "fine", and a variety of other positive things
"que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entienda: understand, he/she/it understand (Entender, subjunctive, 3rd person)
morirse: any use of morir with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to to die)
muero: die, I die (Morir, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Si muere en el avión, dejará a nueve hijos.
englishTranslation: If he dies on the plane, he’ll leave nine children.
vocabIncluded: "the personal a": using an extra "a" before a direct object when it's a person
dejará: will stop/leave/allow, he/she/it  will stop/leave/allow (Dejar, present, 3rd person)
muere: dies, he/she/it dies (Morir, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Te daré un coche cuando tengas quince años.
englishTranslation: I’ll give you a car when you are fifteen.
vocabIncluded: daré: "will give", "I will give" (Dar, future, 1st person)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")
tener X años: to be X years old (idiom)

spanishExample: Tienes que entender que solo tenemos cuatro barcos.
englishTranslation: You have to understand that we only have four boats.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Todos los trece teléfonos murieron ayer.
englishTranslation: All thirteen phones died yesterday.
vocabIncluded: murieron: died, they died (Morir, preterite, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Tres por uno aún son tres.
englishTranslation: Three times one is still three.
